text: welcome to getting started with the ADA
boost toolkit for JetBrains the ADA
breeze toolkit for JetBrains works with
PyCharm and uses the service application
model or Sam to model applications and
their dependent resources it relies on
the associated Sam CLI to do a lot of
heavy lifting so step one in getting
started is to install the Sam CLI so to
get started with the Sam CLI I'm going
to jump over to the server lists
application website and I'm going to
scroll down to the install Sam CLI
section now I am on a Mac here so I'm
going to follow the Mac instructions and
we've got the two main commands that you
need right here on the front page so I'm
going to jump over to a terminal and get
that installed first up brew tap so this
is going to include the AWS specific
recipes that we've and as part of your
homebrew setup and then the next step is
to brew install the ADA rests and CLI
itself
okay now that the Sam CLI is installed
on my machine what I'm going to do is
jump over to pycharm so this is the
PyCharm Community Edition and from here
I'm going to install the AWS toolkit so
from the configure menu I'm going to go
to plugins then I'm going to go to
browse repositories and I'm going to
search for AWS in here I get the AWS
toolkit I'm going to simply install that
it's going to download and install and
put me to restart the IDE okay so we're
going to restart and now that that's
restarted I'm going to go and create a
new service application project so I'm
going to jump into the regular new
project wizard and we now have a Sam
option here on the left-hand side if I
open up more settings then I have a
number of options that I can pick for in
terms of templates I'm going to pick the
HelloWorld one and hit create
so that's going to create my virtual
environment for me and using the Sam CLI
it's going to initialize a service
application including its template and
some source files so that is getting
started on the ADA boost toolkit for
PyCharm using the Sam CLI
